question: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Argonne National Laboratory in Chicago, IL.)  In theory, an omnivorous engine can run on any fuel combination; this one adds butanol, which would result in fewer fill-ups as it's high in energy density, to the common mix of gas & this alcohol
